nodes.text: Remove media, wash cells once with 4°-16° PBS and aspirate PBS.
Remove media, wash cells once with 4°-16° PBS and aspirate PBS.
Add ~1 ml CLIP lysis buffer per 15 cm plate and scrape to collect.
CLIP lysis buffer (Tris pH 7.5 50 mM, NaCl 200 mM, EDTA 1 mM, glycerol 10%, NP40 0.1%, Triton-X 100 1%, N-lauroylsarcosine 0.5%)
Freeze in dry ice and store at -80°.
Thaw lysates by hand and then keep at 4°.
Sonicate lysate for 20-30 seconds at 7 second bursts with microtip sonicator at 10% power
Spin lysate at 14 krcf for 10 min at 4°; transfer cleared lysate to new tube
Add lysates to anti-HA or antibody-precojugated protein G beads. IP 1 h at 4°.
Wash beads 1X High Str, 1X High Salt, 10min each at 4° w/rotation, then 1X Low Salt (1 mL all)
High stringency buffer (Tris pH 7.5 15 mM, EDTA 5 mM, Triton X-100 1%, Na-deoxycholate 1%, SDS 0.1%, NaCl 120 mM, KCl 25 mM)
High salt buffer (Tris pH 7.5 15 mM, EDTA 5 mM, Triton X-100 1%, Na-deoxycholate 1%, SDS 0.1%, NaCl 1 M)
Low salt buffer (Tris pH 7.5 15 mM, EDTA 5 mM)

Perform nuclease digestion: 30°, 15s 1350 rpm, 45s rest, for 3-10 minutes with 0.01-0.1 U/µL RNAse
ONE
Remove RNAse mixture and add 1 mL of 4° High Str buffer to deactivate RNAse ONE.
Wash beads 2X 1 mL NT2, then step down volume in NT2.
NT2 buffer (Tris pH 7.5 50 mM, NaCl 150 mM, MgCl2 1 mM, Igepal CA-630 0.05%)
Resuspend beads in 36 µl of PNK-3' Mix. Inucbate at 37° for 30min, 15s 1350rpm, 90s rest.
Place on magnet and remove PNK reaction (no wash required before ligation).
Ligate 2h to overnight in thermomixer at 16° in 36 µl of 3' Ligation Mix. 15s 1350 rpm, 90s rest
Wash 1X H. Salt or H. Str, 2X NT2.
Resuspend beads in 70 µL of 5'PNK reaction.
Incubate in thermomixer at 37° for 15', 15 s 1000 RPM, 15 s rest.
5' PNK buffer (Tris pH 7.5 50 mM, MgCl2 5 mM, PEG400 16.7%, ATP 1 mM, DTT 5 mM, SUPERase•In 0.33 U/µL, T4 PNK 0.5 U/µL)
3' PNK buffer (Tris pH 6.8 50 mM, MgCl2 5 mM, PEG400 16.7%, DTT 5 mM, SUPERase•In 0.067 U/µL, T4 PNK 0.5 U/µL)
Nuclease digestion buffer (per reaction: 50 µL NT2 buffer with enzyme, 10 µL PEG400)
3' ligation buffer (Tris pH 7.5 50 mM, MgCl2 10 mM, PEG400 16.7%, DTT 5 mM, SUPERase•In 0.13 U/µL, 3' linker oligo 33 nM, T4 RNA ligase I 1 U/µL)
5' ligation buffer (Tris pH 7.5 50 mM, MgCl2 10 mM, PEG400 16.7%, ATP 0.67 mM, DTT 5 mM, SUPERase•In 0.13 U/µL, 5' linker oligo 167 nM, T4 RNA ligase I 0.5 U/µL)
Wash 2X NT2 and step down volume in NT2.
Resuspend beads in 70 µL of 5' ligation reaction.
Incubate at 16° for 2 h, 15 s 1350 RPM, 90 s rest.
Wash 1-2X with NT2 and step down volume in NT1.
Optionally freeze 10% for WB.
Resuspend beads in 20 µL 1.6X LDS.
Heat 75° for 15min.
Run samples in NuPAGE gel, 180V 30-50 minutes, transfer to .45 µm nitrocellulose at 400 mA for 27'.
Rinse membrane 1xPBS, scan on Odessy CLx (lowest quality/resolution OK)
For each sample, add 375 µL PK buffer and 25 µL of Proteinase K (Ambion, 20mg/mL) to a DNA LoBind tube (Eppendorf)

Place the nitrocellulose on PBS-soaked fi lter paper and cut with a scalpel in each hand. We usually cut the minimal region and everything higher. Use a scalpel to transfer the slices of membrane to the Proteinase K mixture.
Incubate at 50-55° for 45min in thermomixer. 15s 900rpm, 45s rest.
Wash 20 µL of oligo(dT)-dynabeads with BIB and leave in 600 µL BIB.
Transfer Proteinase K extract to the oligo(dT) mixture in a DNA LoBind tube. 20 min at 4° with rotation.
Wash 1X BIB, transfer to PCR tube, wash 2X NT2, and 3X with 4° PBS. Include RNAse inhibitor.
Resuspend dT-beads in 12.4 µL water and 3 µL cDNA synthesis primer.
Heat 95° 3' and transfer 13.3 µL sup to new PCR tube
Place tubes at 4° for 5min.
Add the rest of the annealing mix (6.7 µL)
Incubate 53° for 40 min, 55° for 10 min, 80° for 10 min.
node
Distribute 47 µL of PCR1 mix to 7 tubes and add ≤ 3.3 µL RT product to each.
node

Purify PCR reactions using a NucleoSpin® Gel and PCR Clean-up kit (MACHEREY-NAGEL). Instead of the kit's wash buffer, use freshly prepared 85% ethanol. Libraries are ready for quantification and sequencing.
Creation of a protein standard
Quantify the protein concentration of the standard by coomassie gel with a BSA standard curve, or other suitable protein quantification method.
Dilute in protein dilution buffer (0.5X Dulbecco's PBS, 0-5% glycerol, 0.05% Tween-20, 0.15 mg/mL BSA) to 200 ng/µL.
Make two-fold dilutions down from 20-200 ng/µL, depending on how protein is available, for a total of 8 concentrations of protein.
Aliquot ~14 µL of each concentration into striptubes and freeze until use at -80°.
Creation of RNA standard
Add four replicates of 906-1600 µg of 293T/HCT116 lysate from cross-linked cells to ~20 µL Protein G Dynabeads coupled with 25 µL (5 µg) anti-hnRNP C (4F4) antibody per replicate.
Immunoprecipitate at 4° for ~1 hour.
NAse digest with 0.1 U/µL RNAse ONE for 10 minutes.
Perform PNK reaction for 14 minutes at 37°.
Ligate overnight (17 hours) with 20 pmol labeled L5, and 2 µL high concentration T4 RNA ligase (NEB).
Combine samples and split into ~20 aliquots comprising 2.5% of the beads (~10 ng hnRNP C each, ~400 ng total purified) in ~15 µL 1.6X NuPAGE buffer, freeze in dry ice and keep long term at -80°.

Immunoblot with ~1:3000 αhnRNP C conjugated to AF790, or other suitable antibody, in PBS blocking buffer (LI-COR) for ~1 hour at room temperature. Use protein standards to quantify the amount of hnRNP C in the L5-ligated band by quantitative western blotting. ~5000 fluorescence units per fmol is a typical result.
Cross-link rate determination using standards
